plugins.name: Consistent contacts
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to create your own data structure (text or image) and than fill the data into your frames based on matching layer and key name. You have to have the data structure in a predefined JSON format. Example:

{

"records": [

{

"photo": { "image": "avatar-01.jpg" },

"name": "John Doe",

"id": "1234",

"phone": "+1 110-1234",

"company": "TechNova Inc.",

"position": "Software Engineer",

"email": "john.doe@technova.com"

}

]

}

The JSON can be ZIPped with images to a single file, which you can drop to the plugin and populate the frames. The populated frames have to be wrapped together in a parent frame or a component instance works as well. All the frames or instances have to be selected directly to be populated correctly.


WEBP image format is not supported by Figma. JPG and PNG formats works. The whole ZIP file has to be smaller than 1MB, which is a memory limit for any plugin. The ZIP file is remembered, even if you close the plugin, but it is removed from memory and replaced by a new one, if you select a new file.


Not being a developer myself, this is my very first attempt to create a Figma plugin with a huge help from AI. I was able to make it into a working prototype, but there might still be some glitches. If the plugin does not work correctly, check the ZIP content, JSON structure and correct naming of the images. If the plugin stops to work, try to "Clear memory" via a dedicated button. It should reset everything and clean the memory of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Fill in consistent connected data to your frames

plugins.name: SelectLock
plugins.description:
üí™üèΩ Take control of your Figma layers with SelectLock!


SelectLock is your secret weapon for maintaining design integrity in Figma. This powerful plugin lets you lock multiple layers in one go while keeping specific layer types editable.


Here's what you can do:


  1. Bulk lock layers across your entire Figma file
  2. Cherry-pick which layer types stay unlocked
  3. Use a simple checkbox interface for layer selection
  4. Lock your design with just one click
  5. Keep your layer structure intact


Perfect for designers who want to secure their work without sacrificing flexibility. Whether you're polishing a final design or collaborating with a team, SelectLock helps you stay in control. Say goodbye to the tedious task of locking layers one by one. With SelectLock, you're the boss of your design file!


üëâüèº Click here to drop a feedback

üëâüèº Send me a mail


Thank you for using SelectLock.


üëâüèº How to Use


  1. Select the frame or group containing the layers you want to lock
  2. Run the Selectlock plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. In the plugin interface, check the boxes next to any layer types you want to lock/unlock
  4. Click the "Lock/Unlock" button
  5. All checked layer types will be locked/unlocked, while unchecked layer types remain editable/uneditable.
plugins.tagline: Lock specific layer types in bulk. Keep designing freely.

plugins.name: figma-lokalise-unofficial-plugin
plugins.description:
Unofficial Lokalise Plugin.


Enhance Your Design Workflow with Our Figma Plugin for Lokalise


Our plugin bridges the gap between Figma and Lokalise, offering a seamless integration that streamlines your design localization process. With this tool at your disposal, you can:


Link Texts Between Figma and Lokalise: Easily connect text elements from your Figma designs with corresponding texts in Lokalise, ensuring consistency and accuracy across your project.


Update All Texts with One Click: Synchronize all your design texts with Lokalise in just one click. This feature ensures that all your text elements in Figma are up-to-date with the latest translations and content changes.


Switch Texts to Different Languages Instantly: Our plugin allows you to effortlessly change the language of text elements in your Figma designs. This capability is perfect for quickly adapting your designs to various language markets.


Set Individual Text Elements: Gain the flexibility to specify translations for each text element within Figma individually. This feature provides the precision needed for customizing specific parts of your design to suit different linguistic contexts.


Full demo here: https://youtu.be/VPveQklO4OE


Support me at Patreon ‚ù§Ô∏è
plugins.tagline: Bridging Design and Localization in One Click

Auto Palette is a plugin that helps designers extract smart, context-aware color palettes directly from images using precise formulas ‚Äî including average, dominant, and contrast-aware color models.


In a time when Material 3 is embracing expressive tones and iOS 19 leaks tease a UI shift toward progressive blur and dynamic visuals, Auto Palette gives you a reliable starting point to build your own adaptive, fluid color systems.

plugins.description:
üéØ Bulletproof icons


A simple figma plugin to quickly create what I call "Bulletproof" icons for your icon libraries.


Tired of readjusting your icon component layers, so that they don't break in your design? Using different icon from different icon libraries? This plugin will solve the problem of creating consistent icon components.


What does it do?

This plugin will make layer structure for all of your icon like this:


Frame/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Union

‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄVector

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Original


So, when you change color of your icon, resize it or do any other modification, and then change the icon component to another one your modifications won't reset or break. They will be consistent no matter what you do.


How to use?

It's so simple! There's no UI, just select one or multiple frames (not vectors) and run the plugin.

plugins.name: Hilbert
plugins.description:
Weave unique patterns with FASS curves.


FASS stands for 'space-Filling, self-Avoiding, Simple, and Self-similar curves' and they allow you to generate intricate patterns that are made with a single line. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space-filling_curve


How to use:


1) Select an object on your document and press "Pick".


->Your object will then be displayed as a clipping mask to help you preview the result.


2) Play.


3) Press "Place" to apply your artwork to the selected object.


-> The artwork will be clipped inside the object's geometry.


4) Select another object and press "Pick" to apply it as a the new clipping mask.


NOTE: For performance reasons this version is limited to a maximum of 5 iterations.


----------------------------------------------------------------

Want to support the development of free features and plugins?

You can buy me a coffee!

plugins.name: wip!
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to add or remove a red semi-transparent overlay to selected frames in Figma. It is designed to visually mark work-in-progress (WIP) elements directly within the design interface.


How to use

  1. Select one or multiple elements. Currently supporting: Frames, Auto-Layout Frames and Text.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. When a frame is selected, the plugin checks for an existing overlay named 'wip'. If found, it removes the overlay; if not, it creates a new rectangle with a red semi-transparent fill and positions it to cover the entire frame. When a text is selected plugin adds a red semi-transparent fill with the same logic.
  4. To delete the overlay or fill run the plugin again.


This plugin supports frames with Auto Layout, adjusting the overlay accordingly.


You can expect a straightforward way to highlight and manage WIP items in their Figma designs, with limitations around specific node type support.


Add the plugin to Keyboard Shortcuts:

  1. Settings -> Keyboard -> Keyboard Shortcuts... -> App Shortcuts
  2. Press [+] button and choose "Figma".
  3. Write the plugin name "wip!" in menu title. Add shortcut combination. I personally use control + option + w.
plugins.tagline: Show that the selected frames or copy are not yet ready and you're still working on them

plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like üòÄ
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

plugins.name: FigJam Export to Markdown or JSON
plugins.description:
Turn sticky-note chaos into structured documentation.


This plugin reads your FigJam board, detects heading hierarchies by the number of ‚≠ê star stamps on each card, and exports a clean outline ‚Äì perfect for journey-maps, service blueprints, research affinity walls or any workshop board that needs to become a report.


What you get

‚Ä¢ Markdown or JSON with true heading levels (H1 / H2 / ‚Ä¶).

‚Ä¢ Bullet lists for every sticky-note or text card.

‚Ä¢ Embedded screenshots and photos ‚Äì automatically resized, placed under the right heading and zipped into an assets/ folder.

‚Ä¢ One-click download; whole page or just the frames you select.


How it works

1 Structure top-down

Place headings above their content; the heading‚Äôs width defines the column below it.

2 Stamp to mark hierarchy

3 identical stars = H1,‚ÄÉ2 stars = H2,‚ÄÉ1 or 0 = regular content.

(Stars sitting on an image are ignored.)

3 Click ‚ÄúDownload MD‚Äù or ‚ÄúDownload JSON‚Äù

Text-only boards produce a single file; boards with images are delivered as a ready-to-share .zip.


Stop rebuilding journey maps slide-by-slide. Export once, drop the Markdown into Notion, Confluence or GitHub ‚Äì or feed the JSON into your own reporting pipeline.

130930.name: FigJam Export to Markdown or JSON
130930.description:
Turn sticky-note chaos into structured documentation.


This plugin reads your FigJam board, detects heading hierarchies by the number of ‚≠ê star stamps on each card, and exports a clean outline ‚Äì perfect for journey-maps, service blueprints, research affinity walls or any workshop board that needs to become a report.


What you get

‚Ä¢ Markdown or JSON with true heading levels (H1 / H2 / ‚Ä¶).

‚Ä¢ Bullet lists for every sticky-note or text card.

‚Ä¢ Embedded screenshots and photos ‚Äì automatically resized, placed under the right heading and zipped into an assets/ folder.

‚Ä¢ One-click download; whole page or just the frames you select.


How it works

1 Structure top-down

Place headings above their content; the heading‚Äôs width defines the column below it.

2 Stamp to mark hierarchy

3 identical stars = H1,‚ÄÉ2 stars = H2,‚ÄÉ1 or 0 = regular content.

(Stars sitting on an image are ignored.)

3 Click ‚ÄúDownload MD‚Äù or ‚ÄúDownload JSON‚Äù

Text-only boards produce a single file; boards with images are delivered as a ready-to-share .zip.


Stop rebuilding journey maps slide-by-slide. Export once, drop the Markdown into Notion, Confluence or GitHub ‚Äì or feed the JSON into your own reporting pipeline.
130930.tagline: From FigJam to finished journey-map reports in one click ‚Äì stamp, export, done.

plugins.name: Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG
plugins.description:
üé® Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG


Mercurius is a Figma plugin that analyzes and exports images in multiple formats (WEBP, PNG, or JPG) with AI-generated descriptions. The plugin uses OpenAI's API to generate accurate descriptions and suggest meaningful file names while automatically optimizing file size.


Quick Export Mode üì¶

For when you just need to export images quickly with optimization


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. Click "Export Image" on the home screen
  3. You'll see: selected frame name, image dimensions, aspect ratio
  4. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  5. Click "Export" to save your optimized image


AI-Powered Export Mode ü§ñ

For when you want AI assistance with descriptions and smart file naming


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. First-time setup: Enter your OpenAI API key: the key will be securely saved for future use
  3. Click "Analyze Image" on the home screen
  4. The AI will analyze and provide: smart image description, SEO-friendly file name suggestion, image dimensions and aspect ratio
  5. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  6. Click "Export" to save your image with the AI-suggested name



Both modes feature automatic image optimization to meet your file size requirements while maintaining the best possible quality.
plugins.tagline: Smart image analysis and export for WEBP, PNG, or JPG with GPT descriptions and size optimization

plugins.name: Version Stack
plugins.description:
Version Stack allows you to create and manage multiple versions of selected frames in Figma with ease. Each version is automatically saved with a timestamp and arranged in a dedicated ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page using an auto-layout for seamless tracking. Forget manual duplication‚Äîthis plugin ensures that your design iterations are neatly organized and easily accessible.


How to Use:


1.Select a frame you want to save as a version.

2.Run the plugin, and click 'Save Version' . A new version with a timestamp will be saved in the ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page.

3.Each version is stacked vertically in an auto-layout, allowing you to track the evolution of your design effortlessly.


Important Note:

The frame name must remain the same for new versions to be added to the existing version stack.


Limitations:


‚Ä¢Works only with Frame nodes.

‚Ä¢Ensure the ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page is not renamed manually to avoid issues.


We Value Your Feedback:

We‚Äôre constantly looking to improve! If you have any suggestions, feedback, or feature requests, please share them with us. Your input will help make Version Stack even better for you and the design community. Thank you for using our plugin!

plugins.name: Defold Handoff
plugins.description:
With this plugin, you can easily manage GUI template designs and atlases, streamlining the resource handoff process for the Defold game engine. It features a robust customization system for GUI nodes, a Slice 9 generator/editor, and various support utilities and export tools.


Atlases:


  1. Create and manage sprite atlases directly within your Figma project.
  2. Bundle or combine atlases for streamlined export.
  3. Export atlases and image resources for your Defold project with a single click.


GUI Nodes:


  1. Design Defold GUI templates as simple frames in Figma.
  2. Fully leverage Figma's design tools without any limitations from Defold's side.
  3. Edit additional GUI node properties using the custom editor.
  4. Export GUI templates as they are, or bundled with atlases and other resources.
  5. Includes additional support utilities for developers.

plugins.name: Thumb Zone AI
plugins.description:
The Thumb Zone plugin enables you to add your frames to the platform and test it with your users. This plugin can be used for mobile UIs and allows you to perform various types of tests such as UI audit, predicting user behavior, conducting tests with synthetic users, as well as testing with real users to study their emotions.


To add a file from Thumb Zone to Figma, follow the steps below:


  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Define a new product in Thumb Zone.
  3. Select the "Import from Figma" option in Thumb Zone.
  4. Generate a token.
  5. Enter the received token in the Figma plugin.
  6. Select the frames.
  7. Sync!


Frames are synced to Thumb Zone screens, build and test your flow!


Visit https://thumbzone.ai to create your account.

plugins.name: IconPilot
plugins.description:
üöÄ IconPilot: The Ultimate Icon Management Plugin for Your Design System!


Say goodbye to hours of manual work prepping icons for your design system. IconPilot simplifies converting your individual stroke and outline icons into fully customizable multi-variant components in seconds, streamlining your workflow and maintaining consistency across your design system.


‚ú® Key Use Cases:

  1. Quickly convert hundreds of stroke or outline icons into organized multi-variant components.
  2. Define custom sizes, stroke widths, and colors once‚Äîthen apply effortlessly across your entire icon set.
  3. Maintain design consistency using Figma variables to automatically sync icon properties.


üîß Seamless Workflow:

  1. Select your icons (components or frames).
  2. Set variant names, sizes, stroke widths, and colors (raw values or Figma variables).
  3. Click convert‚ÄîIconPilot instantly generates neatly organized icon components ready for your design system.


üí° Powerful Features:

  1. Bulk convert from single icons to thousands at once.
  2. Intelligent Figma variables filtering‚Äîonly relevant variables appear for size, stroke, or color fields.
  3. Auto-generated search-friendly descriptions to effortlessly find icons in assets.
